reviews.text: the best in hell‚Äôs kitchen

We absolutely love this place. The food is very authentic. It‚Äôs a small location, but they do a great job of getting you your order relatively quickly. Everything is very delicious and some people were even waiting outside because of how good the food is. There were also a lot of delivery orders we could see your people coming for takeout. I highly recommend you trying this place. It can get very busy around dinner time so come before then or a little bit after like around 7:30 p.m..
Shabby room, excellent did, tending to very spicy.

Super cute small place restaurant in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen. The food was delicious and had a lot more variety in the menu. I ordered the Khao Soi Moo Krob (pork belly thai curry noodles) and Kaeng Phed Ped Yang (crispy duck red curry).

The Khao Soi Moo Krob was so delicious, a perfect balance of sweet, spicy, and tangy. The pork belly stayed crispy in the broth.

Loved the Kaeng Phed Ped Yang too. The bell peppers and pineapple kept the curry sweet and flavorful. The duck was nice and tender.

There are a lot of fancy/fusion thai restaurants in the city now, but ThongLor keeps the authenticity at an affordable price and adding a lot of unique dishes. Need to try more dishes!

The fried pork tastes bit old, like it was in freezer for a few months before was cooked
But veggies tastes good
Automatically charges you a 20% service fee during checkout and the services is very average, like you pour water yourself.
Food comes fast, which earns another star
D√©licieux si vous aimez la cuisine Tha√Ø venez ici c‚Äôest une valeur s√ªre
Excellent food and a delightful environment! Dishes you can‚Äôt find easily at other Thai restaurants!
Worst pad Thai I have ever had - sickly sweet and tasted like ketchup
Cozy thai place, nothing unexpected and no complaints really ‚ú®
Super lecker und preislich g√ºnstig.
Small place but food was really delicious‚Äînothing like your take out Thai food. We ordered drunken noodles, green curry and pad pal boong and they were all so delicious!
My personal guarantee.
The food was delicious, the atmosphere was wonderful, and the service was excellent.
The owner is really nice and the restaurant is clean.
Great meals!
Very spicy, sour, and a little sweet. So delicious! Taste same like Thailand. The service is great and very nice atmosphere.  Reasonable price! Will come back again.

The pineapple fried rice here is super tasty! I love how they serve it inside a pineapple, it looks so cool. The mix of shrimp, cashew nuts, and sweet pineapple makes the flavor really good. Portion is big too. Totally worth trying :)
The papaya salad is incredibly fresh and flavorful!!!!üòª
The atmosphere is really cozy and pretty. The staff are super welcoming. Would recommend to people in the area.
Beautiful atmosphere with amazing customer service and food

Not sure why this place has 4.8 stars, but from my perspective and experience here, its a 5 star Michelin if ya ask me! One of the best Menus I've seen EVER in a "mom and pop feel shop" - for it to be Thai food it is AMAZING! Our waitress, the staff, the service, EVERYTHING is EXCELLENT!
Best Thai food in New York City, even in Thailand!
Real Thai food. Good taste more than I can say. Yummm!!
Great service also amazing authentic thai food
my favourite
Authentic Thai Food

This cozy Thai spot is a hidden gem. The food is always flavorful and authentic, with the Red Curry Lunch Special being my favorite ‚Äî generous portions and great value. I once had an online payment issue, but Na kindly helped me resolve it right away. Delicious food, fair prices, and excellent service make this place a must-visit.
Really good food! Love the drunken noodles.
Everything was just amazing! I had a good time there. Delicious!! Guess Thai foods are my fav now
Food was excellent and very vegetarian friendly! Service was also amazing!
Delicious meal, Good service and highly recommend
Delicious! Great service and food l
Delicious food, great service, wonderfully cute ambience. Would go back again and again and highly recommend.
The food and the service was absolutely amazing
Delicious food and great service. A must-try for anyone who loves Thai cuisine!
good service good food üëçüèªüëçüèª
Love this place! Fun decor and great food - only downside is a very small dining room with a handful of tables.
So good!
Excellent service and delicious Thai food!
100% recommend this place! The lunch special prices were such a good deal and the food was delicious. Definitely recommend the fried rice and thai iced tea. Fast service and friendly staff
Love their boat noodles! Have been ordering through Uber Eats but glad that I made the trip to the restaurant
Delicious food and kind service!
Always good food, great service. Inside is small but people come in and out, so wait is never that long
The top quality! So good
The food was excellent! And the service was amazing too! Highly recommended!
Food was great, they even have have Chang beer & a bum gun in the bathroom. The waitress‚Äôs name started with an A, she was fantastic

A great spot for newcomers to Thai cuisine‚Äîthe spice levels are mild, making it easy to explore the flavors without feeling overwhelmed. That said, as someone who enjoys more authentic Thai heat, I found the curry lacking the punch I was hoping for. The dish was still tasty, but I was left wanting deeper, more complex flavor notes.

The atmosphere is cheerful and inviting, with golden decor and traditional Thai music that help create a culturally immersive experience.

The staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive, adding to the overall warmth of the visit

Seriously one of the best Thai restaurants in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen. The place is small, but the flavors they offer pack a big punch.

The seafood pad Thai, kangkung, and shrimp eggplant dishes were all the rage. I enjoyed the crispness of the kangkung, the umami from the eggplant, and the tenderness of mussels and squid in their pad Thai. I can‚Äôt wait to come back and try some more of their delicious offerings.

The duck curry (I think this was a panang base) and the som tum was so flavorful and was packed with so much decadence. I really appreciated how ThongLor highlighted produce typically found in Thai cuisine, and didn‚Äôt skimp out on the bamboo shoot. They also added pineapple in their curry, which isn‚Äôt traditional of Thai cuisine but really added some acid to the dish which made it so balanced.

We had a bua loi for dessert and I‚Äôll be honest, it wasn‚Äôt the best one I‚Äôve had, but it still felt like a warm hug and a nice palate cleanser for the meal. I wish that the bua loi had more of a thicker coconut consistency, and that the taro balls weren‚Äôt as stuck together so it was easy to pick up. That being said, it was still a great end to our wonderful meal.

Would I come back again? Absolutely. I highly recommend coming to this place with no more than 4 people. Seating is limited in the space so bring 3 of your closest friends and try everything on the menu.

A hidden gem in Hell‚Äôs Kitchen!

Thonglor NYC is a small, cozy Thai spot with deliciously authentic food and a charming, homey vibe. The space is tight and they don‚Äôt take reservations, so it fills up fast ‚Äî but that‚Äôs part of the experience. The servers were friendly and attentive, and the decor was cute and welcoming.

We started with the crispy golden bags, which were perfectly fried, light, and flavorful ‚Äî a great appetizer.

The yellow curry was rich and comforting with just the right amount of spice, and the portion was generous.

We also tried a seafood dry suki, which was packed with flavor and had beautifully cooked seafood ‚Äî definitely worth trying.

I do wish the place was a little bigger, but honestly, the size adds to the charm. I feel lucky to have this spot in my neighborhood within walking distance. Definitely a go-to for solid Thai food in the city.

Really good spot for Thai. Prices are on the low end with good individual portions. It's a small space if you are going to eat in, I had the chicken pad see ew and fried dumplings. The noodles were very flavorful and everything came out quick and was hot. Would try other dishes here next time I go.

Stumbled in here before a concert and was very pleasantly surprised. It's very small, but is so ornament decorated, and has such a warm atmosphere. You also feel like your right on the street which is very cool. The curry's we tried were very good, and my thai tea was one of the best I've ever had. Our server was very nice as well.

I had the Red Curry Lunch Special and it was absolutely delicious! The curry was rich, flavorful, and had just the right amount of heat. The portion size was generous, and it came with rice and a small side, making it a great value for the price. For something this tasty and affordable, it‚Äôs hard to beat. Highly recommended for a satisfying lunch!

SOOOOOOO good! I happened to stumble upon this place by sheer chance just walking through the neighborhood and it absolutely blew me away. Delicious food, great service, cute ambience, not that much more you could ask for.

Delish food, very authentic and spicy salads. Love that they also import Thai craft beers!
The owners are super lovely and attentive
Authentic flavors and a cozy vibe! The staff is extremely nice and hospitable. Definitely one of the better Thai spots in the area.
If you're in New York and missing Thai food, you have to come to this place! Everything is delicious ‚Äî even better than in Thailand ü§≠ The staff are super friendly too.
The food here is really amazing, well made, fresh and tasty, nice atmosphere! Love this sweet place. Would love to come back

best Thai food and vibes in midtown!
generous portions and the service is amazing, Na always takes care of us.

small note: i recommend for smaller parties as theres limited seating.
Small cozy atmosphere.  Super spicy!   Our 4 is their 2 in hotness rating. Had Spaghetti pad Thai!  Amazing!

Very good, well-flavored classic Thai dishes Lunch specials range from Pad Thai noodles or Khao Pat fried rice with choice of proteins to soups and salads. Each lunch includes an appetizer such as spring roll or soup. We tried a Tofu soup with vegetable fried rice plus a Tom Yum spicy soup with.Vegetable Yellow Corry. Also had a side of the yummy crab and lobster ravioli in spicy Thai sauce which had lemongrass flavors in an aromatic coconut milk broth. Lots of vegetarian and some vegan options. Good for adventurous kids too.  Large menu for such a small place The tiny dining room is adorned in tree branches with golden leaves giving it an exotic yet cozy air. Very nice demure waitress, Quiet crowd. Good value for good size portions, would be great choice for a budget date night. Also a very welcoming place.
The food and ambience is great. We had green thai curry and Pad Kra Pow which was flavorful.
Original Thai Tea taste can be found here! Reasonable price thai food and noodle. Nice staff!

Cool and cozy place with local thai cuisine. The owners just recently moved to NY from Thailand, so you can expect proper thai cuisine.
We found the pad thai a bit too sweet for our taste, but the Pad Kra Pow was great.

This was some of the best Thai I‚Äôve ever had!  To be so close to Time Square there is some hesitation about coming here, but don‚Äôt be afraid! The atmosphere is truly magical, and you will feel sealed away from the bustling city. The northern Thai curries were phenomenal! Our waitress was this lovely little lady who was so attentive of all our needs. Please go support this wonderful business.
amazing experience. waiters were always attentive to the customer‚Äôs experience. also get the mango sticky rice. perfection üëå

Came in around 7pm on a Sunday night and had the place to ourselves for a few minutes before it started to pick up. Limited seating inside keeps a very cozy but not cramped atmosphere. Loved the interior decoration - so pretty with the black and gold! We had drunken noodles and stir fried eggplant with chicken for our entrees and they were both so good. The rice was soft and perfectly fluffy too. Our server was super nice as well. Would love to come back to try the red curry!
The decorations including water cup are immersive. Curry is decent. White rice can be better based on Asian standard. They do have a restroom behind.

I have been ordering and dining at this lovely spot numerous times. The food is excellent and had relatively authentic Thai flavours.

There was once that the online ordering system was having some issues and I was charged twice. Na was very kind and assisted me to resolve the issue immediately.

This cool little spot is great if you are looking for reasonably priced Thai cuisine around the area. Definitely a hidden gem.
Thonglor offers delicious and affordable Thai food in a beautiful setting! We ordered the pad krapow, red curry, and pad see ew and everything was perfect. We will be back for sure!

We had the golden Curry Puff, Crab Rangoon, and the Chicken Jeen Juan Curry. The food tasted good, the Jeen Juan Curry was unique and different than the usual Thai curries we are used to ( haven't seen this curry in the other Thai places I've tried in and around New York) , a little on the spicier side, which is why we loved it! The Crab Rangoon was also pretty good. They also served us with garlic chips which was great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Loved the decor and vibes of this place.

Excellent Thai restaurant.
The food is correctly made, with traditional flavors and very well-executed dishes.
The attention is excellent, and they are always attentive to any consultation of the diner.
The place is intimate and very cozy, set so that it allows you to isolate yourself from the noise of the street.
It has options for all tastes, even vegans and prices are accessible, especially if you take into account the quality offered

The food was great. Every dish was unique and flavorful. The waitress was friendly. The service was a little slow, but that might be due to having only one waitress taking orders. So, if you are willing to wait for great food, this is the place to try.

I had a group of people having dinner here, so I tried many different dishes.

The best was curry puff, I never had this type of food. It seemed fried and heavy but actually it was lighter than I expected, and the dough was a bit chewy which I really liked!

Drunken noodle and beef dishes were so yum, my pad thai was also good but next time I'd get drunken noodle :)

I don't recommend steam veggie dumplings, it had almost no tasteüòÇ

Somehow it took very long to serve the main dish, like more than an hour after the order, even other members who came later got it first.

Atmosphere was nice, well decorated with gold, loved the gold cups, very kind staff, and the bathroom was clean. But it's a tiny space, there are a few tables:)

Overall, it's a nice place! I enjoyed so much!

They don't accept reservations but luckily, my friend and I met up early enough (6 pm on a Wednesday) and we got the last table. The restaurant is very small with maybe six tables inside and two outside. They have a drink menu but I don't think they have their alcohol license yet so I saw other people BYOB.

We decided to order a bunch of things to share:

-Phla Kung (shrimp salad - chili paste, red onion, mint, lettuce in a spicy lime dressing) - we originally wanted to get the soft shell crab salad, but the waitress said it wasn't that good, which I appreciated. We really enjoyed the shrimp salad. The shrimp were big and perfectly cooked, and the lime dressing was so fragrant/flavorful/delicious
-Khao Soi (egg noodles and chicken in a Thai curry broth) - the broth was good but the chicken was not. It had that old leftover chicken taste. You also have to eat the noodles pretty quickly, otherwise it becomes a soggy mess
-Chicken larb - the flavors were good but the chicken again had this leftover taste. The spicy lime dressing from the shrimp salad helped make this dish a bit more palatable
-Pad Thai with mixed seafood wrapped in egg - this was on the ‚ÄúChef‚Äôs Specials‚Äù section of the menu, which I guess meant they put an egg on it and charged $25 on it. So not worth it. There was barely any seafood - just whatever is on top, which was three pieces of squid, two shrimp, and two mussels. The noodles itself were good so you're better off just ordering the regular Pad Thai. That'll save you $9

I would probably come back just for the shrimp salad and maybe even the pad Thai. But just stay away from anything that has chicken in it.

Food presentation and plating was delightful, the taste was superb, the craft beer paired well with the dish, the service above and beyond, and the decor is fun and stylish. Not having been to every Thai restaurant in NYC, I can still safely say that this is at the very least the best Thai experience in Hell's Kitchen. A must-try for any foodie!

For those who are living in NYC or visiting NYC, I highly recommend this Thai restaurant. The taste of the food is like the Thai original style. Full of quality

Decent Thai spot in Hells Kitchen. I enjoyed the small intimate atmosphere  and service was friendly. Food wise it was ok but nothing really stood out and the flavors didn‚Äôt really pop as much I‚Äôd hoped they would based on some of the other reviews on here.

This is the cutest restaurant. Everyone was so sweet and genuine and nice and caring. We got the calamari, drunken noodles, Penang curry and mango sticky rice. Everything was delicious!!! The drunken noodles were spicy but tasty spicy. That is a fine line to balance. 5/5 loved the vibes the food and the decoration! Super authentic :)

The food was amazing! Everything was so delicious! Staff is nice and friendly. The place is small but cozy. We actually spent hours there. Their restroom has an automatic lock and a bidet! Just like in Asia! I love it. Will be back again for sure.

Really lovely food. Maybe the best Thai food I've had. Great presentation. Good balance of flavors (not overly sweet like many Thai places).  We just kept saying "mmmmmmmm"

Update: we went again on 15 September 2022. The service had a lot of issues. We waited for a very long time for our food to arrive. It trickled out and we finally decided to ask for the remainder to go. Great food but the operations need work. Reducing to 4 stars based on the service. Hopefully they'll figure it out.

Delicious Thai food served in a rustic and intimate setting. The stand out dish for me was the Pad Kra Pow Moo Krob (crispy pork basil). I‚Äôve traditionally had this dish with Chinese broccoli, but having it cooked in the delicious basil leaves added that much more flavor! Overall it was a great experience and I‚Äôll be back!

Amazing service and remarkable food. I had the Panang Salmon and it was the bomb! Curry wasn‚Äôt too spicy and it was served with jasmine rice on the side! The waitress was super nice and attentive and the atmosphere was very homey and small but comforting and personable. 10/10 would recommend!
Love it! Very good food and service!

One of the best thai place I‚Äôve had ever in my life. We had the crab fried rice, Tom doom soup. The food came out in around 15 minutes and was delicious. There was only one staff, but she didn‚Äôt awesome job at serving, cleaning, everything. the place was tight, but we got seated right away
Overall food and service were very good. It is a small place, but it has unique Thai feeling gestures.
